tutorial.title: Understanding Flexbox
tutorial.descriptionContent: Learn how to make responsive webpages with Flexbox.

lessons.title: What is Flexbox
lessons.interactiveContent: Let's learn about flexbox, one of CSS's newer features, and how it helps us create responsive webpages like the one below.

lessons.title: Adaptive elements
lessons.interactiveContent:
Flexbox gives developers a lot of flexibility they never had before. It's an essential skill that lets you do more with less code.

With flexbox, elements adapt in size to fit perfectly on different screens. Press the button to see.

lessons.title: Parent and child
lessons.interactiveContent:
To apply flexbox, we first have to make sure the webpage has a parent element with nested child elements inside.

Make sure to pick <div>, followed by </div>.

lessons.title: Flex Container
lessons.interactiveContent:
The parent element is called a flex container. In this example, we'll also give the element the class name container.

Make sure to pick class, followed by =, and finally "container".

lessons.title: Container and child elements
lessons.interactiveContent:
Elements inside the flex container are called flex items. These are the elements that will change their size to adapt to their container.

Make sure to pick class, followed by =, and finally "item".

lessons.title: Display flex
lessons.interactiveContent:
To apply flexbox to the items inside the container, we add display: flex; to the container.

Make sure to pick display followed by : and then flex, ;.

lessons.title: More text
lessons.interactiveContent:
And that's the first step! If we add more text inside the flex items we can see them adapting to fit their container.

Don't worry if a lot seems to be going on. We'll cover what changes happen because of display: flex; in the next chapter.

lessons.title: Question: Adaptive elements
lessons.interactiveContent:
What does flexbox do?

It makes elements adapt in size to fit their parent containerIt changes the size of the parent container

It makes elements adapt in size to fit their parent container.

lessons.title: Question: Parent and child
lessons.interactiveContent:
Which HTML elements do we need to make flexbox work?

A parent element with nested child elementsIt works on any HTML element without the need for nested elements

A parent element with nested child elements.

lessons.title: Question: Flex Container
lessons.interactiveContent:
What is a flex container?

It's the parent element we apply flexbox toIt's the child element we apply flexbox to

It's the parent element we apply flexbox to.

lessons.title: Question: Container and child elements
lessons.interactiveContent:
What are flex items?

The HTML elements inside the flex containerThe HTML elements around the flex container

The HTML elements inside the flex container.

lessons.title: Question: Display Flex
lessons.interactiveContent:
Where does the display: flex; property go?

It goes inside the rule for the flex containerIt goes inside the rule for the flex item

It goes inside the rule for the flex container.

lessons.title: Question: More text
lessons.interactiveContent:
What's wrong with this code?

The flex container is missingThere are no flex items

The flex container is missing.

lessons.title: Example: Parent and child
lessons.interactiveContent:
Code a <div> element with a nested item inside of it.

Make sure to pick <div>, followed by <div>Nested Item</div>, and finally </div>.

lessons.title: Example: Flex container
lessons.interactiveContent:
Apply flexbox to this page by coding the right tag selectors.

Make sure to pick div, followed by button.

lessons.title: Example: Container and child elements
lessons.interactiveContent:
Apply flexbox to this page by coding the right class selectors.

Make sure to pick .container, followed by .item.

lessons.title: Example: Display flex
lessons.interactiveContent:
Apply Flexbox to this page by coding flex.

Make sure to type flex.

lessons.title: Example: More text
lessons.interactiveContent:
Apply flexbox to this page by coding the snippets.

Make sure to pick margin: 10px;, followed by display: flex;.

lessons.title: Intro
lessons.interactiveContent: Let's take a look at all the changes that happen just by adding display: flex; to our code.

lessons.title: One row
lessons.interactiveContent:
By default, flexbox tries to fit items inside a container on only one row.

Make sure to pick display followed by : and then flex, ;.

lessons.title: Height
lessons.interactiveContent:
Flex items automatically stretch to fill their container's height.

Make sure to pick height followed by : and then 200px, ;.

lessons.title: Width
lessons.interactiveContent:
Flex items are as wide as the content inside of them. Add the longer text to see.

Make sure to pick This text is content.

lessons.title: Shrinking width
lessons.interactiveContent:
Flex items can shrink in width so they can all fit in one row inside the container.

Make sure to pick <div class="item">, followed by This is content, and finally </div>.

lessons.title: Wider content
lessons.interactiveContent:
Sometimes flex items can have content inside of them that's very wide and can't be broken up, like a long word.

Make sure to pick Algorithmically.

lessons.title: Content
lessons.interactiveContent:
If the total width of flex items is wider than the container, items overflow outside of the container. Add the longer word.

Make sure to pick Accomplishments.

lessons.title: All elements
lessons.interactiveContent:
display: flex; affects inline and block elements the same. Code a button to see.

Make sure to pick <button class="item">Button</button>.

lessons.title: Basic rules
lessons.interactiveContent: display: flex; is the first step in using flexbox. Next, we'll learn about the different properties we can add to containers and items.

lessons.title: Question: One row
lessons.interactiveContent:
What happens when we apply display: flex; to block elements?

They display on one row as flexbox elementsThey don't change their block element behavior

They display on one row as flexbox elements.

lessons.title: Question: Height
lessons.interactiveContent:
What height value does the flex item have in this code?

The same height as the flex container, which is 200pxIt has a height of 160px because of its padding

The same height as the flex container, which is 200px.

lessons.title: Question: Width
lessons.interactiveContent:
What is the default width of a flex item?

The width of its contentThe width of the flex container it belongs to

The width of its content.

lessons.title: Question: Content
lessons.interactiveContent:
Why are flex items overflowing outside of this flex container?

Because the flex items can't shrink anymoreBecause the container shrinks as much as it can

Because the flex items can't shrink anymore.

lessons.title: Question: All elements
lessons.interactiveContent:
What does this code display?

Two flex items on the same rowOne flex item on the first row, followed by another below it

Two flex items on the same row.

lessons.title: Question: Basic rules
lessons.interactiveContent:
What does display: flex; do?

It's only the first step in using flexboxIt applies all the changes needed to make a webpage responsive

It's only the first step in using flexbox.

lessons.title: Example: One row
lessons.interactiveContent:
Use flexbox to display these list items on one row.

Make sure to pick flex.

lessons.title: Example: Width
lessons.interactiveContent:
Make the flex item have the shortest width possible.

Make sure to pick Content.

lessons.title: Example: Shrinking width
lessons.interactiveContent:
Code the content so that the flex items don't overflow the container.

Make sure to pick #beach.

lessons.title: Example: Wider content
lessons.interactiveContent:
Code the content so that the flex items overflow the container.

Make sure to pick #havingthebesttimeeveronthebeach.

lessons.title: Example: All elements
lessons.interactiveContent:
Code the correct selector to style all flex items.

Make sure to pick .item.
